intro: Cheiridopsis borealis, commonly known as the southern ice plant, is a succulent native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and distinctive flower structures. The plant is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy leaves. It produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Cheiridopsis borealis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its hardiness and aesthetic appeal.
